content:
• Monday, June 25, 2012
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +1.2%) managed to finish higher thanks to positive comments from Baird and Lazard...

    Zynga (ZNGA +1.2%) managed to finish higher thanks to positive comments from Baird and Lazard ahead of tomorrow's Zynga Unleashed event. Baird sees a combo of new Facebook titles, sequels to existing hits such as Farmville, and new mobile titles. The firm also praises Zynga.com for offering a "better gaming experience" than Facebook. Piper is also bullish on Zynga, but is worried tomorrow's event won't address investor concerns. (previous: I, II, III)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • STX

    Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX) up 4.6% AH on news it will replace Progress Energy (PGN) in the...

    Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX) up 4.6% AH on news it will replace Progress Energy (PGN) in the S&P 500 Index after Friday's close. Progress is set to be acquired by Duke Energy (NYSE:DUK).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • OUTR

    Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) -5.2% AH after announcing it has closed its purchase of NCR's DVD-kiosk...

    Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) -5.2% AH after announcing it has closed its purchase of NCR's DVD-kiosk business, and predicting the deal will reduce 2012 EPS by $0.40-$0.50, as the company swaps out NCR's Blockbuster kiosks with Redbox kiosks. The acquisition will also increase 2012 capex by $40M-$45M, though Coinstar promises it will become accretive in 2013. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • APOL

    More on Apollo Group (NASDAQ:APOL): FQ3 blows out EPS estimates despite a weak quarter on the...

    More on Apollo Group (NASDAQ:APOL): FQ3 blows out EPS estimates despite a weak quarter on the revenue side. Total revenue dropped 8/5% Y/Y, due in large part to a 9.1% decline enrollment at the University of Phoenix. The stock is higher in the post-session however, as the company boosts its FY12 bottom-line guidance, now expecting operating income to come in between $700M - $725M. Street estimates are for $713M. Shares +7.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • APOL

    Apollo Group (NASDAQ:APOL): FQ3 EPS of $1.20 beats by $0.24. Revenue of $1.13B (-8.5% Y/Y)...

    Apollo Group (NASDAQ:APOL): FQ3 EPS of $1.20 beats by $0.24. Revenue of $1.13B (-8.5% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +7.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • JRCCQ

    S&P downgrades James River Coal's (JRCC -7.4%) corporate credit rating to CCC+ from B- with...

    S&P downgrades James River Coal's (JRCC -7.4%) corporate credit rating to CCC+ from B- with a negative outlook, citing the warm winter and natural gas substitution which have accelerated a sustained decline in the economic viability of thermal coal produced in the Central Appalachia basin.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • ECA

    Encana (ECA -4.7%) issues its first statement regarding the Reuters article describing possible...

    Encana (ECA -4.7%) issues its first statement regarding the Reuters article describing possible bid-rigging on land leasing in Michigan. “In accordance with Encana's policies, an investigation of this matter was immediately initiated. Encana therefore will not provide any further information at this time," Chairman David O'Brien says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 3 Comments
  • AVD

    Piper Jaffray's recent channel checks indicate American Vanguard (AVD +3.4%) is ready for a...

    Piper Jaffray's recent channel checks indicate American Vanguard (AVD +3.4%) is ready for a powerful Q4 after Q2 but seasonality may weaken Q3 results, as the firm maintains an Overweight rating and a $30 price target on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • CX

    Cemex (CX +4.7%) shares jump after the Mexican cement maker said it is in talks with creditors...

    Cemex (CX +4.7%) shares jump after the Mexican cement maker said it is in talks with creditors to refinance its heavy 2014 debt payment schedule with a proposal to extend maturities by three years. CX has ~$7B in bank debt coming due in 2014 under a $15B financing agreement reached in 2009, when sharp declines in earnings made its debt load unmanageable.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • AGN

    The FDA's approval of Actavis' generic Adderall XR will be a positive for Watson Pharmaceuticals...

    The FDA's approval of Actavis' generic Adderall XR will be a positive for Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI +1%), which is acquiring the company, says Goldman. The firm says the news supports its above consensus earnings estimates, adding that it sees only modest impact to TEVA and IPXL.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • BB

    In response to rumors it's considering a major asset sale or business model change, Research In...

    In response to rumors it's considering a major asset sale or business model change, Research In Motion (RIMM -6.7%) reiterates its commitment to its existing turnaround plan, while noting its recent hiring of JPMorgan and RBC to evaluate "strategic alternatives." Today's huge selloff, fueled by a harsh Morgan Stanley downgrade, drives home just how little confidence the Street has in that turnaround plan.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 4 Comments
  • LKM

    NetQin Mobile (NQ +3.1%) sidesteps today's tech selloff after announcing VC investor Ceyuan...

    NetQin Mobile (NQ +3.1%) sidesteps today's tech selloff after announcing VC investor Ceyuan Ventures has finished distributing its 5.4M share (12.3%) stake in the company to its partners, thus removing a possible overhang. Ceyuan no longer holds any NetQin shares. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • GEF

    Greif (GEF -4%) dips on a downgrade to Neutral at JPMorgan, based on weaker volumes in Europe...

    Greif (GEF -4%) dips on a downgrade to Neutral at JPMorgan, based on weaker volumes in Europe and over-aggressive guidance by the Street. The firm also cuts its price target to $48 from $57.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum (SPRD -5.4%) and Broadcom (BRCM -5.5%) underperform on an ugly day for chip stocks...

    Spreadtrum (SPRD -5.4%) and Broadcom (BRCM -5.5%) underperform on an ugly day for chip stocks (SOXX -2.9%) after MediaTek agrees to buy fellow Taiwanese chipmaker MStar for $3.8B. MediaTek and Spreadtrum are fierce competitors in the Chinese mobile baseband chip market, and Broadcom competes with MediaTek in both the baseband and Wi-Fi/Bluetooth "combo chip" markets. MStar also sells plenty of mobile chips, and that could be heightening competitive concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • TEX

    Shares of Terex (TEX -9%) take a hit as Longbow cuts the stock to Neutral from Buy after...

    Shares of Terex (TEX -9%) take a hit as Longbow cuts the stock to Neutral from Buy after transferring analyst coverage. The firm cites global macro concerns and European exposure for the downgrade.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • MNTA

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (MNTA -19%) gets slammed today after this weekend's unfavorable ruling...

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (MNTA -19%) gets slammed today after this weekend's unfavorable ruling against the company in the Copaxone patent litigation brought against the company by Teva (TEVA +5.6%). Oppenheimer says the stock still has compelling long-term value , despite pressure over the near-term.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • SXL

    Sunoco Logistics Partners (SXL -2.1%) begins an open season for the first phase of its new 150K...

    Sunoco Logistics Partners (SXL -2.1%) begins an open season for the first phase of its new 150K bbl/day Permian Express oil pipeline, one of several new pipeline projects initiated to bring crude oil from the Eagle Ford shale deposit to the Gulf Coast. SXL is offering three-, five- and seven-year terms for shippers interested in moving crude on the line.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • HK

    Halcon Resources (HK -4.1%) forecasts 2012 production to more than double, rising to 9K-11K...

    Halcon Resources (HK -4.1%) forecasts 2012 production to more than double, rising to 9K-11K boe/day from 4,121 boe/day last year, thanks to recent acquisitions in liquids-rich shale acreages. HK also expects Q2 production of 3.9K-4K boe/day.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMRX

    Impax Labs (IPXL -11%) takes a hit on the back of the FDA's approval of Actavis' generic version...

    Impax Labs (IPXL -11%) takes a hit on the back of the FDA's approval of Actavis' generic version of Shire's Adderall XR. Jefferies says the approval means an immediate hit to FY12 - 14 revenue and lowers its price target from $21 to $20.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • KEX

    BofA Merrill downgrades Kirby (KEX -11.7%) shares to Neutral from Buy and lowers its price...

    BofA Merrill downgrades Kirby (KEX -11.7%) shares to Neutral from Buy and lowers its price target to $56 from $69 after the tank barge operator lowered earnings estimates for Q2 and FY 2012, noting softness in its land-based diesel engine services business. KEX plans to shift barges from New York Harbor - a "mess," CEO Joe Pyne says - and move capacity to the Gulf Coast in search of higher margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG +4.4%) jumps after announcing it will be added to the Russell Microcap Index....

    Vringo (VRNG +4.4%) jumps after announcing it will be added to the Russell Microcap Index. Shares rallies last week (I, II) on a favorable Markman ruling in the company's patent infringement suit against several Internet companies, and are up 300% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • VALE

    Vale (VALE -2.8%) tells FT it is preparing to build the world's largest single processing plant...

    Vale (VALE -2.8%) tells FT it is preparing to build the world's largest single processing plant for palm oil in the Amazon rainforest by 2015 to cut its fuel costs and help develop the Amazon region. The project, which will cost more than $500M, will grow palm oil and convert it into biodiesel to run the company's machinery, ships, trains and trucks.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 4 Comments
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK -9.7%) and Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -7.5%) are off sharply, as investors fret Europe's...

    Nokia (NOK -9.7%) and Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -7.5%) are off sharply, as investors fret Europe's debt crisis will prevent the cash-burning companies from raising fresh capital. Nokia is now at levels last seen in 1996, and speculation is growing newly-minted tablet seller Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) will consider buying its Windows Phone partner. Nonetheless, a Microsoft exec asserts his company has no interest in making its own phones, shooting down prior speculation.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 22 Comments
  • CHK

    New allegations of bid-rigging could prove the final blow for Aubrey McClendon, and Chesapeake...

    New allegations of bid-rigging could prove the final blow for Aubrey McClendon, and Chesapeake (CHK -8.2%) could be facing enormous legal headaches as the Justice Department recently has shown interest in prosecuting oil and gas collusion. A case earlier this year indicates the agency likely wouldn't be swayed by claims from CHK and Encana (ECA -5.1%) that they were looking to work on a JV.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM | 9 Comments
  • PHM

    Homebuilder stocks are taking a hit despite the upbeat tone of May's New Home Sales earlier...

    Homebuilder stocks are taking a hit despite the upbeat tone of May's New Home Sales earlier today. Results show just 4.7 months of inventory available, well below the 14.3 months seen in early 2009, and lower than the six months considered to represent a healthy market: XHB -1.4%, PHM -2.1%, DHI -1.2%, TOL -1.5%, KBH -1.7%, MDC -1.9%, NVR -1.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 2 Comments
  • IMMR

    Immersion (IMMR -7.4%) sells off on a downgrade to Sell from Capstone Investments. Reports of of...

    Immersion (IMMR -7.4%) sells off on a downgrade to Sell from Capstone Investments. Reports of of weakening smartphone sales growth are a negative for Immersion, since the company depends on royalties on devices that use its haptic feedback technology.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • PBR

    The Petrobras (PBR -7.5%) five-year investment plan is well-financed, and the company won't need...

    The Petrobras (PBR -7.5%) five-year investment plan is well-financed, and the company won't need to sell new shares to raise capital, according to the CFO of the Brazilian oil major. PBR has planned to finance $208.7B in projects that have been approved, and has a further $27.8B in projects under evaluation that have yet to be financed, Almir Barbassa says.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • GEOY

    GeoEye (GEOY -25.5%) gets crushed after disclosing a government agency won't exercise a renewal...

    GeoEye (GEOY -25.5%) gets crushed after disclosing a government agency won't exercise a renewal option for a satellite imagery program, and is instead proposing less lucrative short-term contracts. In addition, the agency won't be providing cost share funding for an upcoming satellite launch. Benchmark is downgrading shares to Hold, and thinks GeoEye's 2013 bond payments are now at risk. JPMorgan thinks a buyout offer from rival DigitalGlobe (DGI -2.6%) is now more likely. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • RSH

    Companies that sell electronics underperform broad market indexes on heightened concerns that if...

    Companies that sell electronics underperform broad market indexes on heightened concerns that if sales volume fall off, razor-thin margins will see even more pressure from pricing. Falling off: RSH -4.3%, BBY -3.1%, HGG -3.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • ROAN

    Linn Energy (LINE -2%) says its Linn Co. unit filed plans for an IPO of up to $1B in common...

    Linn Energy (LINE -2%) says its Linn Co. unit filed plans for an IPO of up to $1B in common stock; proceeds would be used for general corporate purposes, including financing its acquisition strategy, LINE says. The company has been on a buying spree, including today's acquisition of Jonah Field properties from BP for ~$1B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 5 Comments
  • PLX

    Protalix (PLX -3.7%) slips after being downgraded to Market Perform at Wells Fargo, citing the...

    Protalix (PLX -3.7%) slips after being downgraded to Market Perform at Wells Fargo, citing the CHMP's rejection of Elelyso - despite the drug's favorable benefits - in deference to Shire's Orphan exclusivity status for Vpriv. The firm also lowers its price range to $6 - $8 from $9 - $11.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • DAN

    Auto industry suppliers are falling off on concerns production will come in lower for 2012 that...

    Auto industry suppliers are falling off on concerns production will come in lower for 2012 that originally forecast. China is of special concern, with word out that the government won't provide stimulus to stoke demand. Decliners: DAN -4.7%, FDML -4.6%, AXL -4.4%, TOWR -2.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 1 Comment
  • DELL-OLD

    Reuters reports Dell (DELL-OLD -2.7%), unsurprisingly, is the "strategic bidder" that just made...

    Reuters reports Dell (DELL-OLD -2.7%), unsurprisingly, is the "strategic bidder" that just made a $27.50/share offer for Quest Software (QSFT +5.4%). Quest is currently changing hands at $27.64.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • CAKE

    Cheesecake Factory (CAKE -2.5%) falls off after Buckingham downgrades it to Underperform from...

    Cheesecake Factory (CAKE -2.5%) falls off after Buckingham downgrades it to Underperform from Neutral on the weak trends it sees in the sector and competitive factors.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +2.4%) poke out a gain after Goodnow Investment...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +2.4%) poke out a gain after Goodnow Investment Group sings the company's praises in an interview with Barron's. The investment firm says that the bear camp has GMCR all wrong, with producers lining up to sign deals with the company and recent struggles tied to inventory management, not end demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 4 Comments
  • BB

    The latest rumors aren't helping Research In Motion (RIMM -2.8%), as investors focus on a...

    The latest rumors aren't helping Research In Motion (RIMM -2.8%), as investors focus on a downgrade to Underweight from Morgan Stanley's Ehud Gelblum ahead of Thursday's FQ1 report. While granting "immediate asset sales or strategic options could unleash ~$15/share in value," Gelblum see this as unlikely, and predicts a future of major hardware division losses. His FY14 revenue forecast of $7B is well below a consensus of $12B. (Credit Suisse)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 7 Comments
  • CHK

    Chesapeake (CHK -5.4%) opens trading as the S&P's biggest loser after a report of alleged...

    Chesapeake (CHK -5.4%) opens trading as the S&P's biggest loser after a report of alleged bid rigging by CHK and Encana (ECA -3.2%), plus a story that J.P. Morgan declined to do loan business with CHK for more than 10 years because of credit quality, while Goldman Sachs took the business.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM | 5 Comments
  • SHPG

    Shares of drug maker Shire (SHPGY, OTCPK:SHPGF) -13% in London trading on news the FDA approved...

    Shares of drug maker Shire (SHPGY, OTCPK:SHPGF) -13% in London trading on news the FDA approved a generic version of its attention-deficit and hyperactivity drug Adderall XR. Watson Pharma's (WPI) newly acquired Actavis division obtained an abbreviated new-drug application for the generic. SHPGY -12.2%, WPU +1.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures join EU shares in the red, weighed down by fears that an EU...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures join EU shares in the red, weighed down by fears that an EU summit this week will achieve precious little, which surely isn't a new feeling. The S&P benchmark is -0.8%. Back home, all eyes are on the Supreme Court and a possible verdict today on Obamacare. Meanwhile, Teva is +6.8% following a positive Copaxone patent ruling, although Momenta is -22.1%. Later: New Home Sales, Dallas Fed Manufacturing Outlook
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • STZ

    Shares of Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) move up 3.6% in premarket trading with a...

    Shares of Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) move up 3.6% in premarket trading with a potential deal between Anheuser-Busch InBev and Grupo Modelo shining a light on the sector.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • LXRX

    Premarket gainers: LXRX +8%. TEVA +7%. QSFT +6%. Losers: VTUS -53%. MNTA -23%. SHPGY -12%. CEL...

    Premarket gainers: LXRX +8%. TEVA +7%. QSFT +6%.
    Losers: VTUS -53%. MNTA -23%. SHPGY -12%. CEL -7%. ALU -6%. ARNA -6%. NOK -5%. ING -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • QSFT

    Quest Software's (QSFT +5%) secret strategic admirer comes back with an increased $2.32B bid for...

    Quest Software's (QSFT +5%) secret strategic admirer comes back with an increased $2.32B bid for the company, which is higher than the $2.17B proposed by P-E firm Insight. The suitor, possibly Dell (DELL-OLD), offered $27.50/share, or a 5% premium to Quest's Friday close of $26.22. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • EQNR

    Statoil (STO) says it will lose ~$19M/day due to a strike by offshore workers, and that...

    Statoil (STO) says it will lose ~$19M/day due to a strike by offshore workers, and that deliveries to customers could be disrupted. The Oseberg Field Centre and the Oseberg South and Oseberg East fields in the North Sea will be shut down; production also will cease at the Heidrun field in the Norwegian Sea. STO -1.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM | 3 Comments
  • ASMB

    Ventrus Biosciences (VTUS) plummets 58% after the company says its iferanserin drug for...

    Ventrus Biosciences (VTUS) plummets 58% after the company says its iferanserin drug for hemorrhoidal disease failed to meet the primary end points of a phase 3 trial, the elimination of bleeding, itching and pain. Ventrus has no plans to keep working on the treatment and will instead focus on its other compounds. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • CHK

    Reuters unearths the newest potential skeleton at Chesapeake (NYSE:CHK), reporting Aubrey...

    Reuters unearths the newest potential skeleton at Chesapeake (NYSE:CHK), reporting Aubrey McClendon directed a plot with Encana (NYSE:ECA) to suppress land prices in several prospective land deals in Michigan. Emails reviewed by Reuters could provide evidence the two companies violated federal and state laws. CHK -2.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM | 8 Comments
  • LXRX

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals' (NASDAQ:LXRX) LX4211 oral drug for type 2 diabetes performed well along...

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals' (NASDAQ:LXRX) LX4211 oral drug for type 2 diabetes performed well along with metformin in a Phase 2b trial, lowering average blood glucose levels vs. a placebo. Lexicon aims to conduct phase a 3 study in H1 2013. Shares soar 15.2% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM
  • BHP

    BHP Billiton (NYSE:BHP) -2.1% and Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO) -2.2% premarket after UBS downgrades...

    BHP Billiton (NYSE:BHP) -2.1% and Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO) -2.2% premarket after UBS downgrades their earnings estimates by 4% due to Australia's carbon and mining taxes.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM
  • BMY

    The FDA asks for more information from Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY -6%) and Pfizer (PFE -2.6%)...

    The FDA asks for more information from Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY -6%) and Pfizer (PFE -2.6%) about their new-drug application for Eliquis, which helps prevent strokes in patients with nonvalvular atrial fibrillation. The FDA wants an update on data management and verification from a study of the treatment, although the agency hasn't asked for a new trial.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:55 AM
  • SSNLF

    Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) -4.2% in Seoul amid speculation its Q2 earnings will fall short of estimates...

    Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) -4.2% in Seoul amid speculation its Q2 earnings will fall short of estimates on weaker-than-expected demand for products like televisions. Analysts are also concerned about the impact of a possible H2 slowdown in the smartphone market. The Kospi index is -1.2%, as Samsung makes up 16% of the index.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 AM | 1 Comment
